data.title: In Theaters
data.meta_description: Now playing and coming soon to SIFF Cinema Downtown, SIFF Cinema Egyptian, SIFF Cinema Uptown, and SIFF Film Center.
data.text:
Made in England: The Films of Powell & Pressburger

United Kingdom | 2024 | 131 min. | David Hinton

Now Playing - Aug 22, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Martin Scorsese first encountered the films of Powell and Pressburger as a child, sitting in front of the family TV. When The Archers’ famous logo appeared on screen, Scorsese recalls: “You knew you were in for fantasy, wonder, magic – real film magic.” Now, in this documentary, he tells the story of his lifelong love affair with their movies. See it before our upcoming Powell & Pressburger series (Sep 18-Nov 20).

More Details

Alien: Romulus

United Kingdom | 2024 | 119 min. | Fede Alvarez

Now Playing

SIFF Cinema Downtown

The sci-fi/horror-thriller takes the phenomenally successful “Alien” franchise back to its roots: While scavenging the deep ends of a derelict space station, a group of young space colonizers come face to face with the most terrifying life form in the universe.

More Details

AGFA August: The Peanut Butter Solution

Canada | 1985 | 93 min. | Michael Rubbo

August 23, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Ghosts restore a boy's hair when it falls out from fright, but then it won't stop growing. One of the most powerful and unique “childhood haunts” of the VHS era, full of mind-shattering concepts that still leave viewers in stunned disbelief. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Sugarcane

USA | 2024 | 107 min. | Julian Brave NoiseCat (Secwepemc Nation), Emily Kassie

Opens August 23, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

A gutwrenching doc on the horrors of residential schools, centering on the abuse suffered at the hands of B.C.’s St. Joseph Mission. 2024 Seattle International Film Festival Official Competition Special Jury Prize for Outstanding Documentary. Post-film Q&A on Aug 24 moderated by Tracy Rector with director Julian Brave NoiseCat.

More Details

AGFA August: The Films of the Gay Girls Riding Club (New Restorations)

USA | 1963 | 129 min. | Ray Harrison

August 24, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Double feature of What Really Happened to Baby Jane and All About Alice. Spearheaded by filmmaker Ray Harrison, the Gay Girls Riding Club (GGRC) took California’s 1960s underground gay scene by storm with drag spoofs of classic Hollywood films. Introduction and performance by Seattle Drag Artist Uh-Oh (30 min drag show).

More Details

AGFA August: The Little Shop of Horrors

USA | 1960 | 72 min. | Roger Corman

August 24, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Later adapted into the smash Broadway musical, screenwriter Charles B. Griffith and filmmaker Roger Corman's The Little Shop of Horrors is a classic horror comedy with appearances by Dick Miller and a young Jack Nicholson. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

AGFA August: The Films of Sarah Jacobson

USA | 1996 | 125 min. | Sarah Jacobson

August 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Sarah Jacobson's punk-spirited DIY films from the 1990s combine B-movie aesthetics and riot grrrl feminism, standing as a testament to the vision, determination, and raw talent of the Queen of Underground Cinema. Double feature of I Was a Teenage Serial Killer and Mary Jane's Not a Virgin Anymore, Jacobsen’s only feature film.

More Details

AGFA August: The McPherson Tape

USA | 1989 | 63 min. | Dean Alioto

August 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

The world’s first found footage horror movie! On a fall evening in 1983, a young man videotaping his niece's fifth birthday party keeps the camera running as an alien invasion unfolds. AGFA + Bleeding Skull! are proud to present the world home video premiere of this important milestone in shot-on-video horror history, newly preserved from the original 3/4” master tape.

More Details

AGFA August: The Stairway to Stardom Mixtape

USA | 1972 | 70 min. | Various

August 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

From homemade R&B party hits to aggro stand-up comics, from interpretive dance by zombified children to amateur magicians, Stairway to Stardom is an unending treasure trove of bizarro entertainment that has been a staple among tape traders for decades. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

AGFA August: I Married a Witch

USA | 1942 | 77 min. | René Clair

August 26, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

As a 17th-century New England witch who comes to take revenge on the 20th-century descendant of the Puritan who persecuted her, Veronica Lake is all smolder and disruption. A fun romp from French master René Clair (Le Million). Introduced by SIFF Cinema Program Manager Kasi Gaarenstroom.

More Details

Scope Screenings

USA | 3 hours

August 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Join us at Scope Screenings for a monthly celebration of cinema and community. Each session features a diverse lineup of narrative shorts, music videos, and feature trailers. Doors open at 6:30 PM for socializing, with screenings kicking off at 7:30 PM, creating a dynamic hub for creatives and film enthusiasts alike.

More Details

2024 48 Hour Film Project Awards

USA | 2024 | 120 min.

August 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Come celebrate the best of the 2024 Seattle 48 Hour Film Project submissions. We will screen the award winning films and then hand out awards and make a whole bunch of local filmmakers extremely happy.

More Details

AGFA August: GLOW - The Story of the Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling

USA | 2012 | 76 min. | Brett Whitcomb

August 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

From 1986–92, the airwaves were ruled by GLOW—a neon and glitter-soaked reimagining of the World Wrestling Federation with an all-female cast. This documentary, which inspired the hit Netflix series GLOW, chronicles the rise and fall of the iconic show through the stories of those who lived it.

More Details

AGFA August: She Mob

USA | 1968 | 82 min. | Harry Wuest

August 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A gang of four lesbian inmates escapes from prison and kidnaps the boyfriend of a wealthy woman. An underground miracle that feels like an alt-Earth Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill! as realized by a young John Waters. Introduced by Something Weird Video's Lisa Petrucci and AGFA's Jackson Cooper.

More Details

AGFA August: A Woman Under the Influence

USA | 1974 | 155 min. | John Cassavetes

August 29, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Played by the legendary Gena Rowlands, a housewife on the verge of a nervous breakdown is committed for psychiatric treatment by her loving yet confused husband, with unpredictable results. John Cassavetes’ 1974 masterpiece is one of the most devastating portraits of a relationship ever filmed.

More Details

AGFA August: Faces

USA | 1968 | 130 min. | John Cassavetes

August 29, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

One of John Cassavetes’ most moving efforts, with a stunted atmosphere of tense sexuality, wild outbursts, and off-the-cuff turns of phrase, all seen through the filter of purposefully gritty 16mm B&W. Preservation of the film funded by The Film Foundation with the Hollywood Foreign Press Association in celebration of the 40th anniversary of this Cassavetes classic.

More Details

Jimmy in Saigon

USA | 2022 | 89 min. | Peter McDowell

August 29, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Jimmy in Saigon begins as a personal exploration into the mysterious death and radical life of Jimmy McDowell, an American 24-year-old Vietnam veteran who died as a civilian in Saigon in the 1970s. Director Peter McDowell was only five when Jimmy died, and in his quest to get to know his brother, he uncovers a hidden romance, new family ties and secrets surrounding Jimmy’s drug use and sexuality - a story that takes viewers to Vietnam, France, and across the United States. Director Peter McDowell and Excutive Producer Dan Savage scheduled to attend for a post-film Q&A.

More Details

AGFA August: Shaolin Invincibles

Taiwan | 1977 | 90 min. | Cheng Hoi

August 30, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A young woman becomes a great fighter with powerful skills and fights against her enemies after she's allowed to train in 18 forms of Shaolin kung fu in the Shaolin temple by a golden teacher. Introduced by AGFA Executive Director Jackson Cooper.

More Details

Close to You

Canada | 2023 | 98 min. | Dominic Savage

Opens August 30, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Academy Award Nominee Elliot Page (Juno, The Umbrella Academy, Inception) stars as a trans man who returns to his hometown for the first time in years. On his journey, he confronts his relationship with his family, reunites with a first love, and discovers a newfound confidence in himself.

More Details

Metallica Fest

2024 | 358 min. | Doug Freel & Jean Pellerin; Wayne Isham

August 31, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Experience three Metallica Concert films on the big screen. The first film, “Cliff ’Em All” serves as a tribute to late original bassist Cliff Burton and is a raw collection of performances from 1983 to 1986. The second concert film, “Cunning Stunts,” shows Metallica pushing boundaries musically during their “Poor Touring Me” Tour. The final film covers three nights at Mexico City with 155,000 crazy Metalli-Fans!

More Details

Rap World

USA | 2024 | 57 min. | Conner O’Malley, Danny Scharar

September 1, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

In the feature directorial debut of comedian Conner O’Malley and editor Danny Scharar, three young men (Jack Bensinger, Eric Rahill and Conner O’Malley) self-document their attempt to write and record a rap album in one night. Post-film Q&A with Conner O'Malley, Eric Rahill, and Harris Mayersohn, moderated by Tommy Swenson from The Beacon.

More Details

Movie Club: Irma Vep

France | 1996 | 99 min. | Olivier Assayas

September 4, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Olivier Assayas’s live-wire international breakthrough stars a magnetic Maggie Cheung as a version of herself: a Hong Kong action movie star who arrives in Paris to play the latex-clad lead in a remake of Louis Feuillade’s classic 1915 crime serial Les vampires. Introduced by Social Media Manager Shelby Smout.

More Details

S/He Is Still Her/e - The Official Genesis P-Orridge Documentary

USA | 2024 | 99 min. | David Charles Rodrigues

September 12, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Very few artists lived their art, Genesis died three times for it. Pioneering electronic musician/avant garde artist/spiritual explorer/gender revolutionar y/cult leader? Genesis P. Orridge has been featured in numerous films and videos, but never the full story…never this intimate...until now. Director David Charles Rodrigues scheduled to attend for an in-person Q&A.

More Details

DAN DA DAN: First Encounter

Japan | 2024 | 83 min. | Fuga Yamashiro

Opens September 13, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

GKIDS will theatrically debut the first 3 episodes of DAN DA DAN ahead of the series’ fall streaming release. The event release will also include exclusive content featuring the series’ writer and publisher as well as interviews from the show’s director, producer, and voice actors Shion Wakayama (Licorice Recoil) and Natsuki Hanae (Demon Slayer).

More Details

Scarecrow Video Benefit - House

USA | 1977 | 88 min. | Nobuhiko Obayashi

September 13, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A hallucinatory, psychedelic ghost story that is a certified cult classic straight out of Scarecrow Video's Psychotronic room. Celebrate the weirdness on Friday the 13th at this screening to benefit Seattle's beloved Scarecrow Video.

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp

United Kingdom | 1943 | 164 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

September 18, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

On the British World War II home front an aging gentleman soldier (Roger Livesey), and a brash young one (James McKechnie), learn how to most effectively fight battles of love and war. Mysteriously, a woman Livesey encounters at various stages of his life seems to be the same woman (Deborah Kerr). This is Thelma Schoonmaker Powell’s (Powell’s widow, Scorsese’s triple-Oscar editor) favorite film, not least for its ingenious flashback structure. With Anton Walbrook.

More Details

The Substance

United Kingdom | 2024 | 140 min. | Coralie Fargeat

Opens September 18, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Have you ever dreamt of a better version of yourself? You. Only better in every way. You should try this new product, The Substance. IT CHANGED MY LIFE.

More Details

Edward Scissorhands: Matthew Bourne’s dance version of Tim Burton’s classic

2024 | 95 min. | Matthew Bourne

Opens September 25, 2024

SIFF Film Center

In a castle high on a hill lives Edward; a boy created by an eccentric inventor. When his creator dies he is left alone and unfinished with only scissors for hands until a kindly townswoman invites him to live with her suburban family. Can Edward find his place in the well-meaning community which struggles to see past his curious appearance to the innocence and gentleness within?

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: A Canterbury Tale

United Kingdom | 1944 | 125 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

September 25, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Like modern-day Chaucer’s seekers on the Pilgrims Way to the Canterbury Cathedral, two young soldiers (Sgt. John Sweet, Dennis Price) meet a woman (Sheila Sim) in the dark, and later confront a perhaps dangerous magus-like landsman who might help enact their spiritual destinies.

More Details

Paul McCartney and Wings - One Hand Clapping

United Kingdom | 1974 | 67 min. | David Litchfield

Opens September 26, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

The rare documentary Paul McCartney and Wings - One Hand Clapping is coming to cinemas worldwide for the first time. This screening event includes a recorded introduction by McCartney, as well as unseen polaroids of the band. Relive iconic Wings hits, a reimagined Beatles classic, and captivating performances on the big sreen.

More Details

Sweetheart Deal

USA | 2022 | 98 min | Elisa Levine, Gabriel Miller

Opens September 27, 2024

SIFF Film Center

Four women encounter friendship and betrayal while working Seattle’s infamous Aurora Avenue. Director Elisa Levine, Editor Brittany Kaplan and Producer Peggy Case scheduled to attend for Q&As at the 7:00pm screening on 9/27 and the 1:45pm screening on 9/28.

More Details

Bye Bye Birdie

USA | 1963 | 112 min. | George Sidney

September 28, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Lots of laughs and great songs have made this all-time favorite based on the hit Broadway show one of the most memorable musicals of all time. Legendary actress Ann-Margret scheduled to attend.

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: I Know Where I’m Going!

United Kingdom | 1945 | 92 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 2, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A brash status-obsessed woman (Wendy Hiller) heads north to marry into corporate wealth. But stormy weather strands her on a tiny Hebridean isle, where the landscape, and the alluringly simple life of the locals, seem magical. Are she and the local laird (Roger Livesey) part of an ancient legend? Where is she going?

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: The Red Shoes

United Kingdom | 1948 | 133 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 23, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

The Archers’ most famous film feverishly accompanies a young ballerina’s (Moira Shearer) rise to fame. Dedicated to Art, she’s tempted by earthbound love (composer Marius Goring), but her red shoes dance her on and on. The film that launched ballet dancers of all genders.

More Details

Reel Black: The People Under the Stairs

USA | 1991 | 102 min. | Wes Craven

October 27, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

In a sinister mansion, a family stumbles upon a dark secret beneath the stairs, unveiling a twisted realm of horror and oppression.

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: The Small Back Room

United Kingdom | 1949 | 106 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

October 30, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A scientist (David Farrar) harmed physically and emotionally by the war struggles to keep himself together. His girlfriend (Kathleen Byron) helps, but he’s in danger of disappearing into his nightly whisky bottle. What has he got to lose? He’s just the man to confront an unexploded bomb on a deserted beach. Director Michael Powell knows his suspense: he devised the first Hitchcock Climax for his friend Alfred’s Blackmail, 1929.

More Details

Movie Club: Koyaanisqatsi

USA | 1982 | 87 min. | Godfrey Reggio

November 6, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Drawing its title from the Hopi word meaning "life out of balance," this renowned documentary reveals how humanity has grown apart from nature. Introduced by Cinema Rentals Manager Patrick McFarland.

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: Gone to Earth

1950 | 111 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

November 6, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A nature girl (Jennifer Jones) of the Welsh hills is courted by a pious vicar (Cyril Cusack) and tempted by a roguish squire (David Farrar). Amidst an evocatively rendered sense of place, sacred and profane love entwine in the Celtic twilight.

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: The Tales of Hoffmann

United Kingdom | 1951 | 138 min. | Michael Powell, Emeric Pressburger

November 13, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

Set to Jacques Offenbach’s enchanting music, an archetypal Poet (Robert Rounseville) courts women, his muses (Moira Shearer, Ludmilla Tcherina), in various lands and times, ever pursued by his nemesis (Robert Helpmann). Delectably intoxicating.

More Details

Reel Black: A Wrinkle in Time

USA | 2018 | 109 min. | Ava DuVernay

November 17, 2024

SIFF Cinema Uptown

Guided by celestial beings, a girl battles darkness to find her father in a visually stunning 2018 adventure of love and self-discovery.

More Details

Powell & Pressburger: Peeping Tom

United Kingdom | 1960 | 101 min. | Michael Powell

November 20, 2024

SIFF Cinema Egyptian

A psychologist experiments on his young son, who grows into a gentle, photography-obsessed man (Carl Boehm) who lives to see fear on others’ faces. Can we sympathize with a murderer? Powell calls this a “tender film,” full of empathy for a twisted soul. With Moira Shearer.

More Details
